title:
Lack of self-similarity in transverse velocity increments and
  circulation statistics in two-dimensional turbulence
abstract:
We study the statistics of longitudinal and transverse structure functions,
as well as velocity circulation in the inverse energy cascade of
two-dimensional turbulence. By means of direct numerical simulations of the
incompressible Navier-Stokes equations, we show that transverse structure
functions exhibit an anomalous scaling, in contrast to the self-similar
behavior of longitudinal ones. We argue that the intermittency of transverse
structure functions explains the one observed for velocity circulation
statistics, although they are driven by different turbulent structures.
